The observation facility was 10° direction from the accident site.

The lowest ceiling was broken at 7000 feet Above Ground Level (AGL).
The altimeter setting was 29.89 inches of mercury (Hg).
There was no obscuration at the accident site.

text:
# Meteorological Information and Flight Plan

## Conditions at Accident Site: Visual (VMC)
Condition of Light: Day

## Observation Facility, Elevation: KTYS,980 ft msl
Distance from Accident Site: 8 Nautical Miles

## Observation Time: 17:53 Local
Direction from Accident Site: 10°

## Lowest Cloud Condition: 7000 ft AGL
Visibility: 10 miles

## Lowest Ceiling: Broken / 7000 ft AGL
Visibility (RVR):

## Wind Speed/Gusts: 9 knots /
Turbulence Type Forecast/Actual: / None

## Wind Direction: 280°
Turbulence Severity Forecast/Actual: / 

## Altimeter Setting: 29.89 inches Hg
Temperature/Dew Point: 14°C / 0°C

## Precipitation and Obscuration: No Obscuration; No Precipitation

## Departure Point: Maryville, TN (NONE)
Type of Flight Plan Filed: None

## Destination: Maryville, TN (NONE)
Type of Clearance: None

## Departure Time: 17:30 Local
Type of Airspace: Class G

---
